<JD_START>
Job Title: Staff Accountant

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance

Description:
FlexTrades, a growing, fast-paced, and entrepreneurial company, is the nation’s leading provider of production solutions. We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Staff Accountant to join our finance team. The Staff Accountant will be responsible for assisting with various financial tasks, including but not limited to preparing and examining financial records, reconciling accounts, regulatory compliance, and ensuring compliance with relevant accounting standards. A person who is internally driven to achieve and interested in a wide range of experience will continue to be challenged and be successful in this role. ResponsibilitiesReview and record accounting transactions on a daily, weekly and monthly basis to support business analysis in real time Generate weekly and monthly financial reports to support business analysis Assist with month-end close including preparation of account analysis and reconciliationsReview and record corporate credit card transactionsAssist with ensuring tax and regulatory compliance i.e. preparing business registrations, filing annual reports, researching notices from taxing entities, etc.Cross train to perform as a backup for payroll, accounts payable, and cash receiptsIdentify opportunities for process improvements and efficiency enhancements within the finance departmentAssist with the implementation of additional software and/or accounting modules as needed, including design, testing and documentation of new processesAct as a FlexTrades Core Values champion, by Moving the Line, Being the Next, Elevating Others, Pulling the Wagon, Enjoying the Journey, and Giving BackAll other duties as assigned
QualificationsBachelor’s Degree in Accounting or related field with relevant experience.Minimum 3 years progressively responsible financial operations experience.Solid understanding of GAAP requirements and financial principles.Intermediate computer skills with a focus on Microsoft Excel and accounting software packagesExcellent attention to detail and analytical skills.Strong communication and teamwork skills.Proven ability to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.High level of integrity and ethical standardsBullhorn and Sage Intacct experience preferred.
Compensation and Benefits Package:Competitive salaryBest in Class: Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability and Life Insurance coverage offeredWork remotely in the United StatesPaid holidays, Vacation, & Birthday PTOCompany sponsored personal wellness planHome office equipment provided

Experience Level (if available): Associate
<JD_END>
